intro: Acanthophyllum glandulosum var. roseum, commonly known as the pink spiny broom. It is a low-growing, mat-forming shrub native to arid and semi-arid regions of the southwestern United States and northwestern Mexico. The plant features pale green to grayish foliage with dense, spiny stems that help reduce water loss. Its flowers are typically pink to rose-colored, adding visual interest to its otherwise desolate habitat. It is well adapted to drought conditions and plays a role in stabilizing sandy soils in its native environment.

It thrives in sandy and gravelly soils, often found in desert steppes and dunes. This plant is well adapted to harsh environmental conditions, including extreme temperatures and limited water availability. It plays a significant role in stabilizing sand dunes and preventing soil erosion in its native habitat. Due to its unique adaptations, it is considered an important component of the local ecosystem in these regions.
